pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:0.4.eng: 7. The training rule on building dwellings

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā kosambiyaṃ viharati ghositārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Kosambī in Ghosita’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmato channassa upaṭṭhāko gahapati āyasmantaṃ channaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.2.eng: a householder who was a supporter of Venerable Channa said to him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.3.eng: “I’ll have a dwelling built for you, venerable, if you would find a site for it.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.4.pli: Atha kho āyasmā channo vihāravatthuṃ sodhento aññataraṃ cetiyarukkhaṃ chedāpesi gāmapūjitaṃ nigamapūjitaṃ nagarapūjitaṃ janapadapūjitaṃ raṭṭhapūjitaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.4.eng: While Venerable Channa was clearing a site for that dwelling, he felled a tree that served as a shrine and was revered by village, town, district, and kingdom.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.6.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā cetiyarukkhaṃ chedāpessanti gāmapūjitaṃ nigamapūjitaṃ nagarapūjitaṃ janapadapūjitaṃ raṭṭhapūjitaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.6.eng: “How could the Sakyan monastics fell a tree that serves as a shrine and is revered by village, town, district, and kingdom?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.8.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.8.eng: The monks heard the criticism of those people,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.9.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.9.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.10.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā channo cetiyarukkhaṃ chedāpessati gāmapūjitaṃ …pe… raṭṭhapūjitan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.10.eng: Venerable Channa in the same way.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.11.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ channaṃ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.11.eng: After rebuking Venerable Channa in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Channa:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.12.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, channa, cetiyarukkhaṃ chedāpesi gāmapūjitaṃ …pe… raṭṭhapūjitan”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.12.eng: “Is it true, Channa, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.15.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, cetiyarukkhaṃ chedāpessasi gāmapūjitaṃ nigamapūjitaṃ nagarapūjitaṃ janapadapūjitaṃ raṭṭhapūjitaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.15.eng: “Foolish man, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.18.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.18.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.19.1.pli: “Mahallakaṃ pana bhikkhunā vihāraṃ kārayamānena sassāmikaṃ attuddesaṃ bhikkhū abhinetabbā vatthudesanāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.19.1.eng: ‘When a monk builds a large dwelling with a sponsoring owner and intended for himself,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.19.1.comm: I have rendered sassāmikaṁ as “with a sponsoring owner”. The word sāmika generally means “owner”, and there seems to be no reason why that should not also be the meaning here. However, although the monk does not own the dwelling, he is still the builder and the intended user once the building is finished. To indicate this, I have added the word “sponsoring”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.20.pli: Tehi bhikkhūhi vatthu desetabbaṃ anārambhaṃ saparikkamanaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.20.eng: he must have monks approve a site where no harm will be done and which has space on all sides.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.21.pli: Sārambhe ce bhikkhu vatthusmiṃ aparikkamane mahallakaṃ vihāraṃ kāreyya bhikkhū vā anabhineyya vatthudesanāya, saṅghādiseso”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.21.eng: If a monk builds a large dwelling on a site where harm will be done and which lacks space on all sides, or he does not have monks approve the site, he commits an offense entailing suspension.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.2.eng: one with a sponsoring owner is what is meant.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.2.comm: I render vihāra as “dwelling”, the idea that it is a monastic dwelling being implied. In later usage, especially in the commentaries, vihāra comes to refer to entire monasteries, rather than individual dwellings. The commentaries seem to agree that in its early usage the word refers to a dwelling. Sp 1.493: Vihāro nivesanasadiso, “A vihāra is like a house.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.4.pli: ullitto vā hoti avalitto vā ullittāvalitto vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.4.eng: plastered inside or plastered outside or plastered both inside and outside.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.6.eng: building it himself or having it built.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.8.pli: añño koci sāmiko hoti itthī vā puriso vā gahaṭṭho vā pabbajito vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.8.eng: there is another owner, either a woman or a man, either a lay person or one gone forth.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.11.eng: He must have monks approve a site:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.12.pli: tena vihārakārakena bhikkhunā vihāravatthuṃ sodhetvā saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā vuḍḍhānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.12.eng: the monk who wants to build a dwelling should clear a site. He should then approach the Sangha, put his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.13.pli: “ahaṃ, bhante, mahallakaṃ vihāraṃ kattukāmo sassāmikaṃ attuddesaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.13.eng: “Venerables, I want to build a large dwelling with a sponsoring owner and intended for myself.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.14.eng: I request the Sangha to inspect the site for the dwelling.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.15.eng: He should make his request a second

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.17.pli: Sace sabbo saṅgho ussahati vihāravatthuṃ oloketuṃ sabbena saṅghena oloketabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.17.eng: If the whole Sangha is able to inspect the site, they should all go.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.18.pli: No ce sabbo saṅgho ussahati vihāravatthuṃ oloketuṃ,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.18.eng: If the whole Sangha is unable to inspect the site,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.19.pli: ye tattha honti bhikkhū byattā paṭibalā sārambhaṃ anārambhaṃ saparikkamanaṃ aparikkamanaṃ jānituṃ te yācitvā sammannitabbā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.19.eng: then those monks there who are competent and capable—who know where harm will be done and where no harm will be done, who know what is meant by space on all sides and a lack of space on all sides—should be asked and then appointed.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.20.eng: “And, monks, they should be appointed like this.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.21.eng: A competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.22.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.23.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmo bhikkhu mahallakaṃ vihāraṃ kattukāmo sassāmikaṃ attuddesaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.23.eng: Monk so-and-so wants to build a large dwelling with a sponsoring owner and intended for himself.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.24.eng: He is requesting the Sangha to inspect the site for that dwelling.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.25.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmañca itthannāmañca bhikkhū sammanneyya itthannāmassa bhikkhuno vihāravatthuṃ oloketuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.25.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should appoint monk so-and-so and monk so-and-so to inspect the site for the dwelling of monk-so-and-so.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.27.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.28.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmo bhikkhu mahallakaṃ vihāraṃ kattukāmo sassāmikaṃ attuddesaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.28.eng: Monk so-and-so wants to build a large dwelling with a sponsoring owner and intended for himself.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.29.eng: He is requesting the Sangha to inspect the site for that dwelling.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.30.pli: Saṅgho itthannāmañca itthannāmañca bhikkhū sammannati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno vihāravatthuṃ oloketuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.30.eng: The Sangha appoints monk so-and-so and monk so-and-so to inspect the site for the dwelling of monk-so-and-so.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.31.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa ca itthannāmassa ca bhikkhūnaṃ sammuti itthannāmassa bhikkhuno vihāravatthuṃ oloketuṃ, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.31.eng: Any monk who approves of appointing monk so-and-so and monk so-and-so to inspect the site for the dwelling of monk-so-and-so should remain silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.32.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.33.pli: Sammatā saṅghena itthannāmo ca itthannāmo ca bhikkhū itthannāmassa bhikkhuno vihāravatthuṃ oloketuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.33.eng: The Sangha has appointed monk so-and-so and monk so-and-so to inspect the site for the dwelling of monk so-and-so.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.34.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.36.pli: Tehi sammatehi bhikkhūhi tattha gantvā vihāravatthu oloketabbaṃ;
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.36.eng: The appointed monks should go and inspect the site for the dwelling

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.37.eng: to find out if any harm will be done and if it has space on all sides.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.38.eng: If harm will be done or it lacks space on all sides, they should say,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.40.pli: Sace anārambhaṃ hoti saparikkamanaṃ, saṅghassa ārocetabbaṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.40.eng: If no harm will be done and it has space on all sides, they should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.41.eng: ‘No harm will be done and it has space on all sides.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.42.pli: Tena vihārakārakena bhikkhunā saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā vuḍḍhānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.42.eng: The monk who wants to build the dwelling should then approach the Sangha, arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.43.pli: “ahaṃ, bhante, mahallakaṃ vihāraṃ kattukāmo sassāmikaṃ attuddesaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.43.eng: ‘Venerables, I want to build a large dwelling with a sponsoring owner and intended for myself.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.44.eng: I request the Sangha to approve the site for the dwelling.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.45.eng: He should make his request a second

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.47.eng: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.48.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.49.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmo bhikkhu mahallakaṃ vihāraṃ kattukāmo sassāmikaṃ attuddesaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.49.eng: Monk so-and-so wants to build a large dwelling with a sponsoring owner and intended for himself.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.50.eng: He is requesting the Sangha to approve the site for that dwelling.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.51.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmassa bhikkhuno vihāravatthuṃ deseyya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.51.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should approve the site for the dwelling of monk-so-and-so.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.53.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.54.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmo bhikkhu mahallakaṃ vihāraṃ kattukāmo sassāmikaṃ attuddesaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.54.eng: Monk so-and-so wants to build a large dwelling with a sponsoring owner and intended for himself.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.55.eng: He is requesting the Sangha to approve the site for that dwelling.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.56.eng: The Sangha approves the site for the dwelling of monk so-and-so.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.57.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno vihāravatthussa desanā, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.57.eng: Any monk who agrees to approving the site for the dwelling of monk-so-and-so should remain silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.58.eng: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.59.eng: The Sangha has approved the site for the dwelling of monk so-and-so.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.60.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.63.pli: kipillikānaṃ vā āsayo hoti, upacikānaṃ vā āsayo hoti, undūrānaṃ vā …pe… ahīnaṃ vā … vicchikānaṃ vā … satapadīnaṃ vā … hatthīnaṃ vā … assānaṃ vā … sīhānaṃ vā … byagghānaṃ vā … dīpīnaṃ vā … acchānaṃ vā … taracchānaṃ vā āsayo hoti, yesaṃ kesañci tiracchānagatānaṃ pāṇānaṃ āsayo hoti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.63.eng: it is the abode of ants, termites, rats, snakes, scorpions, centipedes, elephants, horses, lions, tigers, leopards, bears, or hyenas, or any other animal;

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.64.pli: pubbaṇṇanissitaṃ vā hoti, aparaṇṇanissitaṃ vā hoti, abbhāghātanissitaṃ vā hoti, āghātananissitaṃ vā hoti, susānanissitaṃ vā hoti, uyyānanissitaṃ vā hoti, rājavatthunissitaṃ vā hoti, hatthisālānissitaṃ vā hoti, assasālānissitaṃ vā hoti, bandhanāgāranissitaṃ vā hoti, pānāgāranissitaṃ vā hoti, sūnanissitaṃ vā hoti, racchānissitaṃ vā hoti, caccaranissitaṃ vā hoti, sabhānissitaṃ vā hoti, saṃsaraṇanissitaṃ vā hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.64.eng: or it is bordering on a field of grain, a field of vegetables, a place of slaughter, a place of execution, a charnel ground, a park, a royal property, an elephant stable, a horse stable, a prison, a bar, a slaughterhouse, a street, a crossroads, a public meeting hall, or a cul-de-sac—

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.65.eng: this is called “where harm will be done”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.66.eng: Which lacks space on all sides:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.67.pli: na sakkā hoti yathāyuttena sakaṭena anuparigantuṃ, samantā nisseṇiyā anuparigantuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.67.eng: it is not possible to go around it with a yoked cart, or to go all the way around it with a ladder—

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.68.eng: this is called “which lacks space on all sides”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.69.eng: Where no harm will be done:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.70.eng: it is not the abode of ants …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.71.eng: it is not bordering on … a cul-de-sac—

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.72.eng: this is called “where no harm will be done”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.73.eng: Which has space on all sides:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.74.pli: sakkā hoti yathāyuttena sakaṭena anuparigantuṃ, samantā nisseṇiyā anuparigantuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.74.eng: it is possible to go around it with a yoked cart, or to go all the way around it with a ladder—

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.75.eng: this is called “which has space on all sides”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.77.eng: one with a sponsoring owner is what is meant.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.79.pli: ullitto vā hoti avalitto vā ullittāvalitto vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.79.eng: plastered inside or plastered outside or plastered both inside and outside.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.81.eng: building it himself or having it built.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.82.eng: Or he does not have monks approve the site:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.83.pli: ñattidutiyena kammena vihāravatthuṃ na desāpetvā karoti vā kārāpeti vā, payoge dukkaṭaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.83.eng: if the site has not been approved through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements, and he then builds a dwelling or has one built, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.84.eng: When there is one piece left to complete the dwelling, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.85.eng: When the last piece is finished, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.86.eng: He commits an offense entailing suspension:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.87.eng: … Therefore, too, it is called “an offense entailing suspension”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.1.1.pli: Bhikkhu vihāraṃ karoti adesitavatthukaṃ sārambhaṃ aparikkamanaṃ, āpatti saṅghādisesena dvinnaṃ dukkaṭānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.1.1.eng: If a monk builds a dwelling whose site has not been approved, where harm will be done, and which lacks space on all sides, he commits one offense entailing suspension and two offenses of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.1.2.pli: Bhikkhu vihāraṃ karoti adesitavatthukaṃ sārambhaṃ saparikkamanaṃ, āpatti saṅghādisesena dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.1.2.eng: If a monk builds a dwelling whose site has not been approved, where harm will be done, but which has space on all sides, he commits one offense entailing suspension and one offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.1.3.pli: Bhikkhu vihāraṃ karoti adesitavatthukaṃ anārambhaṃ aparikkamanaṃ, āpatti saṅghādisesena dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.1.3.eng: If a monk builds a dwelling whose site has not been approved, where no harm will be done, but which lacks space on all sides, he commits one offense entailing suspension and one offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.1.4.pli: Bhikkhu vihāraṃ karoti adesitavatthukaṃ anārambhaṃ saparikkamanaṃ, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.1.4.eng: If a monk builds a dwelling whose site has not been approved, where no harm will be done, and which has space on all sides, he commits one offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.1.5.pli: Bhikkhu vihāraṃ karoti desitavatthukaṃ sārambhaṃ aparikkamanaṃ, āpatti dvinnaṃ dukkaṭānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.1.5.eng: If a monk builds a dwelling whose site has been approved, where harm will be done, and which lacks space on all sides, he commits two offenses of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.1.6.pli: Bhikkhu vihāraṃ karoti desitavatthukaṃ sārambhaṃ saparikkamanaṃ, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.1.6.eng: If a monk builds a dwelling whose site has been approved, where harm will be done, but which has space on all sides, he commits one offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.1.7.pli: Bhikkhu vihāraṃ karoti desitavatthukaṃ anārambhaṃ aparikkamanaṃ, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.1.7.eng: If a monk builds a dwelling whose site has been approved, where no harm will be done, but which lacks space on all sides, he commits one offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.1.8.pli: Bhikkhu vihāraṃ karoti desitavatthukaṃ anārambhaṃ saparikkamanaṃ, anāpatti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.1.8.eng: If a monk builds a dwelling whose site has been approved, where no harm will be done, and which has space on all sides, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.2.3.pli: Tassa vihāraṃ karonti adesitavatthukaṃ sārambhaṃ aparikkamanaṃ, āpatti saṅghādisesena dvinnaṃ dukkaṭānaṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.2.3.eng: If they build a dwelling whose site has not been approved, where harm will be done, and which lacks space on all sides, he commits one offense entailing suspension and two offenses of wrong conduct. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.2.4.eng: where harm will be done, but which has space on all sides, he commits one offense entailing suspension and one offense of wrong conduct. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.2.5.eng: where no harm will be done, but which lacks space on all sides, he commits one offense entailing suspension and one offense of wrong conduct. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.2.6.eng: where no harm will be done, and which has space on all sides, he commits one offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.6.1.eng: A monk appoints someone to build him a dwelling and then departs.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.6.2.pli: Tassa vihāraṃ karonti adesitavatthukaṃ sārambhaṃ aparikkamanaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.6.2.eng: They build a dwelling whose site has not been approved, where harm will be done, and which lacks space on all sides.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.6.3.pli: So ce vippakate āgacchati, tena bhikkhunā so vihāro aññassa vā dātabbo bhinditvā vā puna kātabbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.6.3.eng: If it is unfinished when he returns, that dwelling is to be given to someone else, or it is to be demolished and rebuilt.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.7.1.pli: Attanā vippakataṃ attanā pariyosāpeti, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.7.1.eng: If he finishes what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.7.2.pli: Attanā vippakataṃ parehi pariyosāpeti, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.7.2.eng: If he has others finish what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.7.3.pli: Parehi vippakataṃ attanā pariyosāpeti, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.7.3.eng: If he finishes himself what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.7.4.pli: Parehi vippakataṃ parehi pariyosāpeti, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:3.7.4.eng: If he has others finish what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
